title: Submittal Tracking and Management: Streamlining Approval Processes
excerpt: Learn how effective submittal tracking and management streamlines approval processes in construction projects. Discover best practices for managing product data, shop drawings, and material approvals.
content:
Submittal Tracking and Management

Submittal management is a critical component of construction project documentation. Managing the submission, review, and approval of product data, shop drawings, material samples, and other submittals requires systematic processes to ensure timely approvals and compliance with project requirements. Effective submittal management prevents delays, ensures quality, and maintains project momentum.

Construction projects typically involve hundreds or thousands of submittals, each requiring review and approval before materials can be ordered or work can proceed. The complexity of tracking these submittals through their lifecycle—from submission through review, approval, and final disposition—demands organized systems and clear processes. When submittals are managed poorly, projects face delays, quality issues, and budget overruns.

Understanding Submittals

Submittals are documents or samples submitted by contractors for review and approval:

  • Product Data: Manufacturer's product information and specifications
  • Shop Drawings: Detailed fabrication or installation drawings
  • Material Samples: Physical samples for approval
  • Mix Designs: Concrete and material mix specifications
  • Test Reports: Material test results and certifications
  • Certificates: Compliance and quality certificates

Submittal Process Workflow

Effective submittal management follows structured workflows:

  • Preparation: Contractors prepare submittals per specifications
  • Submission: Submit through formal transmittal process
  • Logging: Document control logs all submittals received
  • Distribution: Distribute to appropriate reviewers
  • Review: Review for compliance and approval
  • Decision: Approve, conditionally approve, or reject
  • Response: Return reviewed submittals to contractor

Submittal Register Management

Comprehensive tracking requires detailed registers:

  • Submittal Logs: Maintain detailed logs of all submittals
  • Status Tracking: Track status of each submittal through process
  • Due Dates: Monitor submittal deadlines and required dates
  • Approval Status: Track approval, rejection, or revision status
  • Revision Tracking: Manage multiple revisions of submittals

Review and Approval Procedures

Structured review ensures quality:

  • Review Criteria: Establish clear review standards
  • Reviewer Assignment: Assign appropriate reviewers by discipline
  • Review Timelines: Set and track review deadlines
  • Approval Authority: Define who can approve different submittal types
  • Conditional Approvals: Manage approvals with conditions

Submittal Software Tools

Modern tools streamline submittal management:

  • Procore: Comprehensive submittal management features
  • Autodesk Construction Cloud: BIM 360 submittal tracking
  • Project Management Software: Integrated submittal modules
  • Document Management Systems: Custom submittal workflows
  • Spreadsheet Tracking: Simple tracking for smaller projects

Shop Drawing Management

Shop drawings require special attention:

  • Coordination Drawings: Ensure coordination with other systems
  • Compliance Review: Verify compliance with design documents
  • Fabrication Review: Check fabricability and constructability
  • Revision Management: Track all shop drawing revisions
  • Approval Stamps: Maintain proper approval documentation

Material Sample Management

Physical samples require handling:

  • Sample Logs: Track all material samples submitted
  • Storage: Properly store samples during review
  • Display Organization: Organize samples for easy comparison
  • Approval Documentation: Document sample approvals
  • Return Procedures: Return or dispose of samples appropriately

Best Practices for Submittal Management

Successful submittal management requires:

  • Early Planning: Identify submittal requirements early in project
  • Clear Procedures: Establish clear submittal procedures
  • Timely Processing: Process submittals promptly to avoid delays
  • Communication: Maintain clear communication with contractors
  • Quality Control: Ensure thorough review and compliance
